content.description: Short and sweet, fun pockets - poop in some takes away a star for me though.
content.location: Left most route of the left semi-detached pillar of Full Charge.

content.description: Ramble up the three bulges. A little harder than its neighbors to the left.
content.location: Fourth route from the right. Between Last of the Pagans and Still Fuc%ing Waiting.
Just left of the bulging arÃªte.

climbs.name: Still Fuc%ing Waiting
climbs.fa: Equipped by Charlie Kardalef, FA Mike Snyder, 2012

content.description: Climbs through the 3 bulges. The final bulge is the test, a long reach helps otherwise youll have to tick tack the small crimps.
Start on balancy terrain and move through bulges, use thinner pockets and a fin to reach the anchor.
content.protection: 6 bolts to anchors, 1st bolt very low
content.location: To the right of Blunderbuss, to the left of Still F*cking Waiting

content.description: The business of this route is right after you step off the ground and seems to be a bit harder the shorter you are.  Great water sculpted pockets lead you up into a chimney.  Stay left and continue up until you can step right and transfer onto the knife blade feature.  Not very hard but very cool, opposing side pulls actually pull outward so you can walk your feet up this crazy fin.  A great and unique CK creation.
content.location: In the Alcove beginning on the steep streaked and pocketed wall on the left.

content.description: Start on Swashbuckler, finish on Bite Me.
Start on Swashbuckler, finish on Oftedal Serenade.
Cool climbing up the bulges on dreamy buckets.  The clipping stancefor the anchor chains is off of under clings forcing a strange move.
Traverse left on jugs with empty feet to shoot the black bulge on reachy pockets with a cruiser finish
content.location: The first route right of the Full Charge cave, straight through the black bulge

content.description: Creep onto the wall under the roof and carefully ease your way through the first crux. Wind up and left to reach the giant pockets and traverse right, under the roof, to turn the lip near the crack. Regroup at the ledge stance, then follow giant pockets up the creamy headwall. The black bulge guards the anchor; there are no more big buckets. Fantastic route! Long too. It's best to have a follower clean it.
content.protection: 10 bolts. Anchor is 1 open cold shut & 1 rap ring.
content.location: Follow the approach for Lake Point Crag, when you reach the cliff walk to the right.  Cross two talus fields and find the towers with an alcove at the base.

content.description: Start in a thin seam down low, then pull up and left onto gorgeous jugs to finish at the bulge.
content.location: Starts in a seam just right of a large boulder and left of the climbs beneath the roof.  This is the left variation and shares its start with another climb.

content.description: Fun climbing that packs a great variety into a short pitch.
content.location: Second climb right on the left semi-detached pillar of Full Charge

content.description:
Slightly cruxy start then climb through several HPLs (horizontal pocket lines) on great holds. The guidebook calls this 10b but it is much easier than

The Last Pagans

next door.
content.protection: Half a dozen bolts to bolted anchor.
content.location: Located on the rightmost panel of rock at the crag.

content.description: Begin as with Oftedal Serenade but at the chimney around bolt 6, stem over behind you and transfer to the other wall.  Slabble dabble up to the chains.  Not as fun as Oftedal but good nonetheless.
content.location: Follow the approach for Lake Point Crag, walk to the far right.  The climb in the alcove on the pocketed left wall.
